messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] a list of lists?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Actually the link Rue sent (http://groups.yahoo.com/search?query=Home+education+magazine) -- I think she just searched for home education magazine at
messages.messageBody:
on 7/10/03 1:38 AM, Helen Hegener at HEM-Editor@... wrote:

> We're planning on building a page at the Unschooling.com site for all
> the new lists, with descriptions and links and such, but our
> webmaster's still on vacation...

Actually the link Rue sent
(http://groups.yahoo.com/search?query=Home+education+magazine) -- I think
she just searched for "home education magazine" at yahoo and then sent the
url to that page -- worked pretty well.

Though there's at least one missing (Unschooling-Days). If all the list
descriptions had "Home Education Magazine (HEM)" in them (maybe some just
say HEM?), they should all turn up. (And if that exact phrase is used with
the (HEM) in it, it should eliminate the HELM lists.) Then the list would be
assured of being current whereas a webpage might not, considering the
penchant some people have for creating lists ;-)

Joyce


1 Unschooling-Politics
A discussion list for news, legal and legislative issues, political action
and more of interest to unschooling families. Sponsored by Unschooling.com,
a web-based service of Home Education Magazine.
32 For Members
2 Unschooling-Resources
A place to share information about books, movies, websites, computer
software, magazines, games, toys, museums, historical sites, video games or
whatever else might be of interest to unschooling families. Sponsored by
Unschooling.com, a web-based service of Home Education Magazine.
65 For Members
3 Unschooling-101
A place to learn about unschooling from experienced unschoolers. Sponsored
by Unschooling.com, a web-based service of Home Education Magazine.
79 For Members
4 HEM-Resources
This is a list for discussion of learning materials, and will include posts
of commercial press releases, product announcements, and other news about
resources of interest to homeschooling families. Sponsored by Home Education
Magazine.
217 For Members
5 HEM-Networking
This list is sponsored by Home Education Magazine (HEM) for networking and
communication within the online homeschooling community. All topics of
interest to homeschoolers are welcome and encouraged. The usual rules of
common sense and courteous interaction should be applied when responding to
others on this list. Please do not post spam. For information about the many
other lists sponsored by Home Education Magazine send an email request to
HEM-Editor@... with the words HEM ... more
569 For Members
6 Unschooling-Discussion
Let's talk about unschooling! If you have questions about this list please
contact list moderator Joyce Fetteroll (fetteroll@...) This list
and the Unschooling.com web site were created and are supported by Home
Education Magazine (http //www.home-ed-magazine.com)
1266 For Members
7 HEM-Letters
The HEM-Letters email list was created specifically for discussion of issues
of interest to homeschoolers, and for those discussions to be considered for
publication in Home Education Magazine's Letters & Discussions section.
Posts will be edited for length, spelling, typographical errors, etc. - but
meaning and intent will not be changed, and all selected posts will be
available for review before actual publication in Home Education Magazine.
Everyone is welcome to join the list. However, if ... more
67 For Members
8 HEM-SupportGroups
The HEM-Support Groups list is sponsored by Home Education Magazine (HEM) to
provide news, information, support and encouragement for people who help
homeschooling families through their local, state, regional or national
support group, association, or other membership or service organizations.
175 For Members
9 HEM-Conferences
This is a networking list for Home Education Magazine (HEM) writers and
columnists, and others who may be interested, who speak or give workshops on
homeschool-related topics, and for conference planners and support group
contacts to discuss and coordinate promotion of homeschooling and Home
Education Magazine. Our goal is to encourage dialogue between those who want
to speak and give presentations on homeschooling and those who provide the
conferences, workshops, and other forums to reach ... more
72 For Members
10 HELMNews
Home Education Learning Magazine's Free Online News http
//www.helmonline.com HELM, Home Education Learning Magazine announced the
launch of its free online news! On October 1, 2001, Home Education Learning
Magazine began publication and distribution of a monthly internet news
service. Home Education Learning Magazine Online News is free and available
to anyone with a working e-mail address. Information about how to receive
the News is included below. HELM editors, Donna M. De Poalo and Karen M. ...
more
11 HomeEducationLearningMagazine
Home Education Learning Magazine (HELM) "A bimonthly print publication
focusing on independent learning and self-directed education." To subscribe
to HELM go here http //www.helmonline.com/pages/mag/subscribe.html If you
would like to read articles that have been published in previous issues of
Home Education Learning Magazine click on the 'Bookmarks' links in the left
sidebar. Contact Information Donna De Poalo, Editor Donna@...
Karen M. Gibson, Editor Karen@...
< 5 Public
12 HEM-Daily
A short daily feature from the editors of Home Education Magazine,
featuring, at various times, news, interviews, quotes, items of interest,
opinion polls, links to check out, recipes, helpful hints, resources,
reviews and more.
< 5 Public
13 HEM-CreativeIdeas
This list is - as the title implies - a collection of creative ideas from
homeschoolers, a wide-ranging resource list, a place to post your arts and
crafts recipes (silly putty, goop, gak, bubblestuff, playdough,
fingerpaints, etc.), science experiments (baking soda volcanoes and food
color rainbows), and "Kids in the Kitchen" recipes. But let's range further
afield, and explore even more options for creative homeschooling. Share your
favorite learning-oriented or just plain fun websites, the ... more
195 For Members
14 justjennymccarthy
JENNY MCCARTHY http //www.jenny-mccarthy.com/ http //www.jenny-mccarthy.com/
Family Youngest sister Amy McCarthy Younger sister Joanne McCarthy Older
Sister Lynette McCarthy Personal Manager Ray Manzella Dog Bubba She grew up
with her three sisters, a stay-at-home mom, and her father, a steel-plant
foreman. Education Attended Southern Illinois University at Edwardsville for
nursing Some Facts She was MVP of her high school softball & field hockey
team In 1993 she was a struggling model, until ... more
21 For Members
15 HEM-Unschooling
This list is for discussion of unschooling hows and whys, wherefores and
methods, sharing good resources, and so on and so forth. Sponsored by Home
Education Magazine.
206 For Members
16 HEM-EdPrograms
This list is sponsored by Home Education Magazine (HEM) for discussing
issues relating to public and private school programs, specifically those
which are directed at and marketed to homeschooling families. JJ Ross
outlined these key points, which many listmembers agreed with in early June
2002 1. Home education is a unique learning lifestyle chosen by and centered
on one family, rather than any public or private institution. 2. Public and
private institutions and programs have an interest in ... more
80 For Members
17 FamilyTimesOnline
Home Educator's Family Times is the homeschool magazine perfect for new or
veteran homeschool families from unschoolers to traditional learners.
Written by nationally recognized experts each issue covers Research on
Education and Homeschool Issues Successful Homeschool Strategies Practical
Tips and How-To Articles Special Concerns - From the Gifted Child to Special
Needs Resource Network - Resource Reviews Conference Information and Updates
Online and print version available. Also in PDF format. ... more
26 Public
18 HEM-Movielovers
This list was created for Movielovers! Join us for discussion of the best
new movies, the best old videos, and everything in between. Share your
favorite movie moments, discuss background details, movie goofs, favorite
actors and actresses, and yes - even how movies can be used in
homeschooling. But this isn't strictly a "how to enrich your curriculum"
list - it's just for homeschoolers of all ages who love movies! Sponsored by
Home Education Magazine.

At 3:54 AM +0000 7/10/03, thinkspringblooms wrote:
>i'm wondering if there's a list anywhere--besides in the archives of
>this list--of the new lists that were created out of this one last
>month.

We're planning on building a page at the Unschooling.com site for all
the new lists, with descriptions and links and such, but our
webmaster's still on vacation...

Helen

messages.subject: a list of lists?
messages.msgSnippet: i m wondering if there s a list anywhere--besides in the archives of this list--of the new lists that were created out of this one last month.  maybe a
messages.messageBody:
i'm wondering if there's a list anywhere--besides in the archives of
this list--of the new lists that were created out of this one last
month. maybe a place/page in groups.yahoo.com somewhere, for which i
could share a link or url with my local support groups and lists?
anyone know where/how to hook up with a list like that? have i used
the word list in this post about lists enough times? <g>


thanks.
cris
